alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Juneau; Monroe; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 3:25AM CST until February 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain This Morning... .A potent, quick moving storm system will bring freezing rain to parts of the region this morning, generally around and north of the Interstate 94 corridor. The freezing rain transitions to snow in the afternoon, with most of those impacts holding north of Highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin. The freezing rain will reach the I-94 corridor by 5 am, continuing to spread northward and nearing Highway 10 in north-central Wisconsin by 7 am. Untreated surfaces, including roads and sidewalks, will quickly accrue ice. The freezing rain will generally persist for about 2 to 3 hours near I-94 before warmer temperatures start to move in. North of there, freezing rain could persist through most of the morning. There will be a change over to snow for the afternoon north of highway 29 in north-central Wisconsin, with 1 to 2 inch accumulations. Temperatures will play a key role in icing amounts. Small changes could result in substantial shifts in impacts. Pay close attention to the forecast for any revisions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain, mostly along and north of interstate 94. Ice accumulations from a glaze to as much as 2 tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Buffalo, Trempealeau, Monroe, Juneau and Adams Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions in some locations. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
